title: Chapter Content Generation Workflow Timeline
description: 8-stage process for generating educational chapter content (total: 144 seconds)

items.title: Verify chapter index.md exists with required structure
items.description: This initial validation ensures the chapter file is present and follows the expected format before proceeding with content generation.

items.title: Parse and validate title, summary, concepts list, prerequisites
items.description: Ensures all required frontmatter and structural elements are present and properly formatted.

items.title: Extract target audience from course description and determine appropriate complexity
items.description: Analyzes the intended audience to set vocabulary, sentence structure, and conceptual complexity.

items.title: Load reading-level guidelines and content-element-types specifications
items.description: Retrieves templates and standards that guide content structure and educational elements.

items.title: Generate detailed educational content with examples, exercises, and non-text elements
items.description: The core generation phase creates comprehensive chapter content aligned with concepts and learning objectives. Duration varies by chapter length (60-180 seconds).

items.title: Cross-check generated content against concept list for completeness
items.description: Ensures every concept from the chapter's concept list is adequately covered in the generated content.

items.title: Replace TODO placeholder with generated content in index.md
items.description: Updates the chapter file with the newly generated educational content while preserving frontmatter and structure.

items.title: Generate summary statistics (word count, elements, concepts covered)
items.description: Provides detailed metrics about the generated content for quality assessment.
